summary: Department of Defense leadership and defense contractors have expressed concerns about the length of time it takes to award contracts, and DOD has proposed reducing that time. We found DOD does not know how long it currently takes to award contracts and therefore does not have a baseline to measure progress in reducing time frames. DOD components—for example, the Air Force—collect some data on award...
title: Defense Contracts: DOD Should Develop a Strategy for Assessing Contract Award Time Frames
